advisory.name: RLSA-2021:1809
advisory.synopsis: Moderate: httpd:2.4 security, bug fix, and enhancement update
advisory.topic:
An update for the httpd:2.4 module is now available for Rocky Linux 8.
Rocky Enterprise Software Foundation Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
advisory.description:
The httpd packages provide the Apache HTTP Server, a powerful, efficient, and extensible web server.
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
Additional Changes:
For detailed information on changes in this release, see the Rocky Linux 8.4 Release Notes linked from the References section.

fixes.description: CVE-2018-17199 httpd: mod_session_cookie does not respect expiry time
unorderly connection close when client attempts renegotiation
mod_ldap: High CPU usage at  apr_ldap_rebind_remove()
CVE-2020-11993 httpd: mod_http2 concurrent pool usage
httpd: typo in htpasswd, contained in httpd-tools package
mod_cgid takes CGIDScriptTimeout x 2 seconds for timeout
only one url is displayed using "htcacheclean -p . -A" when there are >= 2 files in one subdirectory
mod_proxy_hcheck Doesn't perform checks when in a balancer
Thousands of /tmp/modproxy.tmp.* files created by apache
